attributes.action: Do not make any changes to the current devolution arrangements
attributes.background: In 1997, the people of Scotland voted very decisively to have a devolved Scottish Parliament and devolved powers as well, and they are within an EU framework. But now, the UK government is planning a ‘power grab’ on these areas such as agriculture, farming and fishing.
attributes.additional_details: So I call on the UK government not to change the current devolution settlement. They say it will be more expensive to have different sets of rules, but I don’t agree with them. If they want a UK-wide framework, then maybe they could look towards having a federalised framework rather than a ‘power grab’.

attributes.action: Introduce a requirement for address verification for internet applications
attributes.background: We've got to get real regarding issues with Bots and third-party actors on social networks and other internet applications. The hate and anger we are seeing online must be stopped and one of the only tools we have to do so is to make people prove who they say they are.
attributes.additional_details:
What I am proposing is this...

Any application designed for access by the general public and allowing internal messaging or commenting or any other intra-user communication must verify the postal address of users.

All applications to either filter out un-verified users by default or provide a mechanism to allow users to opt-in and opt-out of receiving messages from un-verified users. 

All existing application users to be subject to the same verification procedure within a time limit.

attributes.action: 5 year driving ban for speads in excess of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.background: A driver who speeds excessively is aware of their actions. Therefore an immediate ban of 5years should be given to those driving in excess  of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are killed each year by speeding drivers. If those drivers were told if they speed more than 10mph over the specified limit they would be banned from driving for 5 years. We would have a lot of people asking themselves is it rely worth the risk of 5 year  instant ban.

attributes.action: Start a British Foreign Legion.
attributes.background: Many British Army applicants are turned away due to their history of mental illness, certain complications such as having had a detached retina and also those with a criminal background. However The French Foreign legion could accept these failed applicants and they often prove to be great recruits.
attributes.additional_details:
So I ask that a British Foreign Legion is formed so Patriots of this country who were rejected by the British Army can serve their country, as I believe it is wrong that many patriots like my self are not given this opportunity, due to their pasts.
Just like the French Foreign legion, people who want to come to this country to make a better life for themselves could do so by serving five years in the British Foreign legion. After that time is served they can be granted British citizenship.

attributes.action: Reform the law on incarcerating drug addicts, introducing harm reduction clinics
attributes.background: The 'Harm Reduction' drug policy used in Switzerland in the 1980's  has had a range of positive impacts on addicts, and should be used in the UK.Two-Thirds of the addicts who entered the harm-reduction clinics found full time jobs as they did not spend their time and money financing their addiction.
attributes.additional_details:
- http://vancouver.ca/people-programs/four-pillars-drug-strategy.aspx
 - https://www.globalcommissionondrugs.org/the-hardline-approach-to-drugs-must-end-by-richard-branson/
- http://www.smh.com.au/comment/swiss-recipe-for-dealing-with-drug-addiction-proves-a-success-20130622-2opcj.html

The benefits that addicts can receive from the harm reduction strategy hugely outweighs the 'positives' brought by the more traditional, hard-line policy that punishes and incarcerates addicts which inevitably worsens their addiction and leaves them stripped of opportunities when released.

attributes.action: Get Michael Gove to maintain farming subsidies after Brexit.
attributes.background: Under current EU legislation farmers in the UK receive 3 billion pounds year in subsidies mostly in basic payments which are based on per acre owned of land.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove the environment secretary has pledged post Brexit to maintain the basic payments for most farmers for a transition period only. He is in the meantime reviewing several options to cap the payments and introduce progressive reductions.

The petition is to maintain the payments to the farmers.

British Farming employs 3.8 million people and is a business worth 109 billion. The idea of the petition is to educate the public about the value British farming has on the country and ask for their support by signing a petition to lobby their MP’s to support continuing subsidies for British farmers.

attributes.action: Let 15 year olds take their CBT once they reach their final school year
attributes.background: When you're 16, you can take your cbt, ride a motorcycle, buy energy drinks, and get a job, however a 15 year old in the same school year can’t do any of these things. How come you're mature enough to be in the same school year, but not to have any of the perks?
attributes.additional_details: I found it especially frustrating, having a birthday in August, I had to see teenagers, who were in the same school year and learning the same as me ride motorbikes, and get jobs, while I was stuck in a village with no transport, a friend of mine in the same school year had a motorbike and had no issue, for instance, I could have been doing motorvehicle as an apprenticeship, but not be able to get a licence until after someone who’s never driven before, even though their the same year

attributes.action: Make snow days in school a legal requirement when snowfall is over 2 inches.
attributes.background: I believe that england doesn't see much snow and when it does the children in schools need time to appreciate it. Maybe they could dabble in winter sports or just have a simple snowball fight. It can als be dangerous to get children to school as the roads will become icy and dangerous for driving.

attributes.action: Stop change 4 life's campaign on healthy eating and lifestyle
attributes.background: Change 4 life's campaign for a healthy lifestyle is supposedly trying to help children. However, exposing nutritional values to children or such young ages can become a main cause of developing an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details:
Children and young adolescents should be able to enjoy a carefree childhood without the pressure of obsessing over the things they eat. Everything in moderation is healthy and children should be encouraged to believe this. Eating disorders are on the rise but yet this campaign is still choosing to fuel them and ignore the high mortality rate
 as a result of these illness'.

attributes.action: Allow children to start school at 4
attributes.background: I have been told that my 3 year old will have to wait until he is 5 before he starts main stream school because his birthday is September(After June). Why can't children start when they are 4 or start them according to their learning and only hold them back if they need the extra help
attributes.additional_details: I personally would much rather my son have an extra year at school than an extra year in nursery.

attributes.action: Black Ancient History to be taught in schools. As a course, module, in all level
attributes.background: In school the only recollection of any study about Africa, was based upon African colonisation, and pro independence; this was fine, until I started to come across information about African Ancient History post university, by myself, with the help of the internet. I felt overwhelmed and shocked.
attributes.additional_details:
I did Politics and International Relations Degree.

Nevertheless missing African Ancient history is like missing a huge chunk of world history.

If the following is included in the educational system, it would be great. Information about.....

- Nubia



- Songhai

- Lost African Kings and Queens such  as: Nefertiti, Sheba, Hannibal

- Kemet

- Ashanti

- Moors (when blacks ruled Spain)

 -Benin Empire(1180-1897 CE) , Mali Empire (1235-1600 CE) , Ghana Empire (700-1240 CE)

+ more

attributes.action: Charge a set £5 fee for every use of the NHS (i.e. GPs, ambulance or hospital)
attributes.background: Although we pay a contribution toward the NHS from our wages I feel there should also be a set fee.  We pay for home and motor insurance that we may never use, and when we do we pay an excess.  I feel the NHS should be no different.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is a great service, but society has changed considerably in the 70 years since its inception and the way the NHS is funded should be changed to reflect this.

attributes.action: A call for Highways England to make more sections of the M5 a smart motorway
attributes.background: Somerset Chamber of Commerce has long campaigned for better road infrastructure. The M5 is one of two main arterial routes into the South West. Frequently, the M5 between Gloucester and Exeter is affected by either full or partial closures affecting productivity, lost opportunity and serious injury.
attributes.additional_details: Following a freedom of information request to Highways England, it was confirmed that from 01/09/15 to 01/09/16 there were 16,934 incidents recorded on the M5 between Exeter & Gloucester, of which 3,547 resulted in full or partial closure, equating to an average of 10 accidents per day. The smart M42 motorway has resulted in no fatalities, reduced injury accidents by over 50%, and journey reliability improving by 22% since 2006, delivering major socio-economic benefits which could be replicated.

attributes.action: International British Medical Students should be funded by the Government (SFE).
attributes.background: NHS has a massive shortage of doctors. British Medical Students studying in international universities have to take on great financial burdens to achieve their dreams of becoming doctors. These students are then coming back to the UK to support our NHS. So, shouldn't the government support them!
attributes.additional_details: Student Finance England (SFE) should support British Medical Students studying in European or International Medical Universities.  NHS has a massive shortage of doctors. British Medical Students studying in international universities have to take on great financial burdens to achieve their dreams of becoming doctors. These students are then coming back to the UK to support our NHS. So, shouldn't the government support them! These students are the backbone of the NHS!

attributes.action: Make all healthcare assistants registered and Band 3/4
attributes.background: Healthcare assistants are forefront in hospitals, care homes and many other places. Some healthcares have been working in the profession for 10years or more yet we are not reconigsed. We simply just known as 'just a healthcare assistant'
attributes.additional_details:
Help us get registered and recognised for what we do on Band 3/4
Healthcare assistants are not just bed bath washers or dinner deliverers.
We do bloods, cannultion, blood pressures, blood sugars,vaccines i.e flu vaccines, wound care along with patient personal care and comfort. 
For what we do in our job role we do not get the recongition like we should and to be on band 2 where secretaries are band 4 is unfair.

attributes.action: Ban the use of video interviews using computer analysis to select candidates
attributes.background: Many companies have began using video interviews in their application process. These interviews are reviewed by a computer and never seen by a person. The algorithms used cannot account for behavioural differences exhibited by people with disabilities and so, it removes them as viable candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Video interview algorithms are set up to analyses both verbal and non-verbal communication. The main problem with this system is that the characteristics which are deemed to be ‘good’ are generally characteristics which people with learning difficulties, such as ADHD or Aspergers will never display under the circumstances of a video interview. In an actual face to face interview, the interviewer can understand and account for the difference in communication while an algorithm cannot.

attributes.action: I believe that every adult in the UK should pay £10 a month to the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been admitted into hospital twice in 5 years for 2 major life changing operations. I noticed how loving and caring the porters, nurses, doctors and surgeons all were. I was very shocked to see that they work 12+ hours a day, clean, cook, pay for parking and bring their own food.
attributes.additional_details: I would rather spend my £13.12 (which I have to pay every month for my BBC TV LICENCE) on the NHS. It should be compulsory!

attributes.action: Standardise the tax rates for employment income with all other income sources
attributes.background:
If you receive most income from your employment, there is a 99% chance that you are probably ‘poor’ or, at least, not part of the 1% high wealth individuals.
The wealthy avoid high employment income tax rates and instead exploit generous allowances and lower tax rates on all other forms of income.
attributes.additional_details:
By standardising the tax rates on all forms of income, employment tax rates will fall since the disproportionate tax benefits available to the super-rich only will be reduced to create a fair tax system.

All income say, under £1m, including receipts from loans from non-UK sources and gains from share schemes, should be treated equally for tax purposes and thereafter a minimum tax rate of 10% should cap any excessive tax breaks. 
Personal allowance and capital gain exemption could also be combined.

attributes.action: Examine Greybull's actions in respect of insolvency of Monarch Airline/Holidays.
attributes.background: Monarch ceased trading on Monday 2 October 2017, leaving 2,000 employees without jobs and 860,000 passengers without flights. This is Greybull’s third venture that has failed and the largest failure in British aviation history.
attributes.additional_details: We question the entire involvement of Greybull Capital in respect of Monarch. From reports it would appear that both prior and post insolvency the UK Government have pumped millions of pounds into Greybull Capital and although Greybull state they have lost out in excess of £100 million it is reported that Monarch had £48 million in the bank and aircraft take off and landing slots will be worth at least £60 million to Greybull. These figures alone equate to greater than £100 million.

attributes.action: Provide option to pay an extra 10 to 20% Council Tax & choose where it's spent.
attributes.background:
With all the cuts to services I suggest people are given the OPTION to pay an extra 10, 15 or 20% on their Council Tax via a tick box AND be able to choose where the money is allocated via a few more tick boxes i.e.
- Policing
- NHS
- Schools
- Local Town Council
- Social Services
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us are unhappy & frustrated with the spending cuts that have impacted so many services. There is too much emphasis on keeping Council Tax down without giving people the OPTION to pay more if they want to and have a say in where it is spent. 

I would be happy to pay an extra 10% provided it went on local policing and I am sure many people who could afford it would feel the same, albeit with differing priorities.

attributes.action: Ban fake numbers being used for sales, marketing, PPI and personal injury calls.
attributes.background:
We frequently receive calls about that 'accident' we've had or about that PPI claim we could make.

Companies use a fake number, so that you have no way of tracing where the call from and so they are unaccountable.  

I propose that UK phone networks apply technology to block such calls.

attributes.action: provide free water for everyone on the street of UK in this extreme hot weather
attributes.background: I think water must be free in this hot weather for everyone specially homeless people living on the street. The government must provide funding to local councils to facilitate the supply of free water in the street on UK. The local government must help local shops to provide water to everyone.
attributes.additional_details: The condition is extremely hot and people can get dehydrated and homeless people are at higher risk. Water must be provided by the local government in form of a water fountain or local shops providing them by local council finding them. This is a government’s duty to keep their people safe.

attributes.action: Brexit re article 50 it must not be suspended/stopped under any circumstances
attributes.background: the full details are well known to everyone the media has covered it fully
attributes.additional_details: the british people MUST be given the Brexit they voted for anything else is not acceptable to the british public  ARTICLE 50 must not under any circumstances be hindered/suspended/stopped for any reason whatsoever  the time is here to take action as there has been excessive feet dragging/delaying tactics by those opposed to brexit

attributes.action: It should be mandatory for schools to provide a summer uniform
attributes.background: Schools should have to provide a summer uniform for its students such as shorts, and a polo shirt or similar. This would help people concentrate in lessons because they wouldn’t be overly hot, like I was this summer.

attributes.action: Limit new drivers 1100cc- first 12 mths, 14000cc-12-24 mths, 1600cc-24-36 mths
attributes.background: The cost of insurance is too high and the volume of accidents involving young drivers is also too high, bringing this in would hopefully reduce both

attributes.action: Require all buses to have seat belts
attributes.background: Buses have crashes and make sudden stops and people get injured all the time because they are not wearing seat belts.
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was involved in a bus accident (not the bus driver’s fault) where a taxi pulled out. This resulted in me being thrown from my chair and suffering bruised ribs and jarred my chest. This is why all buses should be required to have seat belts.

attributes.action: Require local councils to issue parking charges by recorded delivery
attributes.background: Sending PCNs by 2nd class postage does not guarantee delivery to home addresses and as a result quite often representation or appeal of the contravention is missed. Recorded delivery would eliminate this issue and the cost should be added to the original PCN meaning no cost to the council.
attributes.additional_details: There are many instances on multiple forums of people experiencing this exact issue. It’s unfair to not have received the original letter on time and as a result the fine being multiplied and even in some cases warrants issued to bailiffs. I personally didn't receive the first PCN letter and the fine was £65, now the fine is £195 as a result of not receiving the 2nd class letter sent out by the local council. Is this fair or just a money making loop hole by the councils.

attributes.action: Give free sanitary products for girls in primary and secondary schools.
attributes.background: As the fifth largest economy no girls should be in a place where sanitary products are not available in school. As of next year Wales will give out free sanitary products to all girls in primary and secondary schools. It now time to follow in Wales footstep.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/free-sanitary-products-given-schoolgirls-14805724

attributes.action: Increase funding for local councils to tackle homelessness.
attributes.background: Poverty in general is a prevalent issue in the UK; homelessness rates have been significantly increasing; why is the government's form of action evidently not working, if there is any?

attributes.action: Hold a general election within the next 2 years
attributes.background: We are in the middle of the Brexit process and the government has made no progress at all so far, when we’re about to leave the EU in March next year.  This literally shows that this government is too weak to govern the country and to come to an agreement on terms.
attributes.additional_details: Also, some council elections will be in May 2022, which means the General Election will clash with the council elections and we’re supposed to have one election within this five year timeframe, not more than one.

attributes.action: Full Public Investigation into all Unresolved Complaints of NHS Medical Errors
attributes.background: For over 40 yrs, the system has failed to protect patients who have suffered medical accidents/errors under the NHS. A toxic culture has prevailed within the NHS of closing ranks to cover up complaints. We need a new body to investigate all unresolved complaints and the misuse of powers/public money
attributes.additional_details: Given the gravity of scale of covering up by the NHS & lack of action taken by complaint bodies & those in Government, this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate all complaints. In order to avoid harm to patients the government need to carry out an investigation across the UK to identify the systemic failure across the NHS & avoid future harm to patients. It must include victims left with ongoing health problems/disabilities & families who have lost a loved one since 1980

attributes.action: Lower the age of consent to 14 or 15
attributes.background: I believe that people hit puberty at about 12. At 14-15, people are still going through puberty but I believe that they are also mature enough to give consent.
attributes.additional_details: Underage sex/pregnancy is a big issue. Moving the age of consent down, while still keeping it at an age where people are old enough to give consent, would reduce underage sex.

attributes.action: Remove the VAT on purchase of defibrillators
attributes.background: Encourage the purchase of these life saving devices. Small communities are raising funds to buy these defibrillators for no reason other than to save life. Maybe yours, maybe mine, or maybe a loved one. Remove the tax and encourage the acquisition of this life saving and life changing technology

attributes.action: Cap Tax Avoidance - Introduce 1% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: It is not unreasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated fairly and equally under the tax legislation.  The minimum corporation tax rate based on turnover should be the mechanism to ensure that this happens.
attributes.additional_details:
The minimum corporation tax can be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.   The new tax could easily be extended in the future to include all cypto-currency transactions to ensure the tax compliance.

On average, the FTSE 100 companies’ corporation tax expense to turnover has gone from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years and companies like eBay pay even less with 0.2% of their turnover going to the UK Tax-man!

attributes.action: Tax breaks for public houses that ONLY serve beverages manufactured in the UK.
attributes.background: To aid against the loss of public houses across the UK, many of which are central to a community. Also providing a boost to UK brewers/manufacturing. And creating more jobs in this sector.

attributes.action: Make the Monday following remembrance Sunday a public holiday.
attributes.background: Every other EU country have a public holiday to remember out fallen. We should forward the same respect to our fallen and currently serving member of our armed forces.

attributes.action: Impose a term limit on all MPs of 10 years (no limit on election cycles)
attributes.background: Over the past 30 years, a political class has developed of people who know nothing but politics. They have never done a real job or worked in the private sector. After University they become bag carriers, SPADs and then MPs. They live in a bubble and do not understand concerns.
attributes.additional_details: A term limit of 10 years - irrespective of the number of general elections - would give an MP enough time to learn the ropes of Westminster and be able to make a contribution to society and their constituency. It would increase the turnover and mean that they could not make this their sole career. More people would be able to participate, reduce hostility/apathy toward UK politics and people with a more varied life experience other than life in politics would get a voice in parliament.

attributes.action: Immediate cap on fees charged by letting agents
attributes.background: The rental market is open to abuse by letting agents who can name their price; there is no correlation between the costs they incur and the fees charged. It's a free for all, with fees for the same processes widely differing for no apparent reason but to put more money in the pocket of the agent.
attributes.additional_details:
Do these examples seem fair?

Print & sign tenancy contract: £120
What does it really cost to print a document?

Credit check: £100
Credit checks typically cost less than £30

Moving in fee covering background & credit check: £395
That's £395 BEFORE you've even paid your rent & deposit. And if you 'fail' you lose your money.

We're not proposing scrapping the fees, after all the agents do incur costs. But a cap would give clarity for all, and prevent profiteering hitting renters in the pocket.

attributes.action: Renationalise all rail as they do not care for the consumer at all.
attributes.background: The new timetable that has been released has been a complete mess as their have been hunders of cancellations in peak times. They have removed services to blatantly avoid paying delay repay. Its abhorrent they get away with this and its about time the rail companies became publically owned.
attributes.additional_details: Check any timetable and you'll see the amount of services cancelled daily.

attributes.action: Ban Abortion in 2018
attributes.background: Abortion should be illegal in all circumstances. The Abortion Act of 1967 left loopholes that allow too many abortions. There are alternatives to abortion: keep the baby, adoption or fostering, and medical research to prevent abortion being the only option when women are at risk during pregnancy.
attributes.additional_details: Many women have more than one abortion. This costs taxpayers' money, some of which goes to private providers, and increases pressure on our NHS, which is already under huge strain. 2012 figures suggest that the NHS may spend over £800,000 a week on “repeat” abortions. That is the hidden cost of abortion. The Government must invest more in educating people to avoid unwanted pregnancies and provide better support for young mothers and single mothers. Everyone has the right to life.

attributes.action: Stop private parking companies from imposing fines after you leave the premises.
attributes.background: Parliament should legislate to stop Private Parking Companies from imposing penalty charges after a vehicle has left the location where enforcement is in place.
attributes.additional_details:
Private parking companies should only be able to impose a charge on the spot or must install barriers at entry and exit points to accept payment.
 
Issuing notices by post should be prohibited. 
 
It is a simple solution to a very controversial industry.

attributes.action: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour
attributes.background: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour.  When you attend a hospital for treatment or to visit someone then you are probably under stress, so finding extra money to pay for car parking (especially the high charges some hospitals charge) is just adding to the stress your under.
attributes.additional_details: I suspect that some people are choosing to go without food etc just to pay for car parking charges which can mount up if  you are there for some hours and have to visit on several occassions.  The government intervened in the gambling laws they could intervene in this. These charges effect the most vunerable in our society, the sick, low paid, the ones that can't afford to go private.

attributes.action: Lower the university fee for all students! By atleast £1000
attributes.background: Students are thinking about university as summer starts however most are drawn back due to the large amount of cash they have to pay per year! The goverment need to start deciding what to put their money on wisely if they want a bright future for the UK.

attributes.action: Condemn killings by the Indian government
attributes.background: On 23rd May 2018, Indian and local Tamil Nadu government forces killed 13 unarmed civilians protesting against environmental disaster created by Sterlite copper in Tuticorin, TN owned by Vedanta resources plc.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must condemn this human rights violation and urge the India Government to protect human rights, including people’s right to protest.

attributes.action: To implement a notice period before stopping disability benefits after reviewing
attributes.background: At present many genuine disability claimants are losing benefits without any prior warning after going through a biased assessment process. Thus placing them instantly into financial difficulties and a world of uncertainty & worry even rendering many unable to actually pay the bills etc.
attributes.additional_details: Being thrust into a world of woe. Going through the stresses of being suddenly financially restricted then chasing the gov for reconsideration and then forcing an appeal process which many win this process surely costs the gov even more going through the whole tribunal process takes months to  year. Yes the money gets backdated. But all that addition stress and worry is totally Unnecessary. In human rights terms it's totally disgusting that our DWP treats the disabled this way.

attributes.action: Allow Left turns on red like in the USA
attributes.background: So in the USA you can legally turn Right on a red light which helps with easing traffic and lowering co2 emmisons So I think that when applicable We should be allowed to turn left on red due to us driving on the left side of the road. This would greatly decrease co2 emmisons and traffic in cities.

attributes.action: Parliament should debate the future of UK overseas territories
attributes.background: At present UK overseas territories have an anomalous status that allows them to be used for money laundering and other nebulous purposes while at the same time denying their inhabitants full sovreignty and a say in the most important aspects of their governance.
attributes.additional_details: Ideally Overseas Territories should be asked to choose between full independence within the Commonwealth or becoming integrated parts of the UK with Westminster representation (after the model of French overseas department).

attributes.action: Make homework voluntary across all schools.
attributes.background: As it’s mental health awareness week, it got me thinking about how anxious I used to be when I did not complete my homework when I was a student. I used to make myself sick or just go AWOL at school. I see the same pattern occurring within my children’s behaviour.

attributes.action: Urge the Commonwealth to suspend Pakistan’s membership.
attributes.background: The former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, has not been given a fair trial by the Supreme Court of Pakistan. His life and political career may be in danger.
attributes.additional_details:
The Supreme Court of Pakistan has taken away the right from Nawaz Sharif to contest the next general elections in Pakistan. He has also been disqualified from Prime Ministership. Nawaz Sharif is a target of the Pakistan Army and Supreme Court of Pakistan. 
 
The UK Government should urge the Commonwealth Ministerial Action Group to suspend Pakistan’s Commonwealth membership, until they give fair trial and right to contest election to Nawaz Sharif.

attributes.action: Establish an Atrocities Prevention Board.
attributes.background: Human rights and the prevention of mass atrocities should be at the centre of our foreign policy thinking. An Atrocities Prevention Board, made up of representatives from across government, would ensure a comprehensive approach to identify and address threats to vulnerable groups of people.
attributes.additional_details:
Barack Obama established an Atrocities Prevention Board (ABP) in 2012. It has improved the US government's ability to identify early threats and widened the tools with which those threats can be dealt with. It has also provided the impetus to take early action in a number of countries that might otherwise not have received such attention.

A UK equivalent could spur on a similar change and ensure that genocide and mass atrocity prevention are a priority at the highest levels of government.
